did.unittitle: International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers Arbitration Files on Microfilm
did.abstract: Files concerning the October 19, 1961 arbitration between the IBEW and Raytheon in Boston, MA.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers (IBEW) represents approximately 750,000 active members and retirees who work in a wide variety of fields, including utilities, construction, telecommunications, broadcasting, manufacturing, railroads and government. The IBEW has members in both the United States and Canada and stands out among the American unions in the AFL-CIO because it is among the largest and has members in so many skilled occupations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Files concerning the October 19, 1961 arbitration between the IBEW and Raytheon in Boston, MA.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers Arbitration Files on Microfilm #5414 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
